text:
Grand Concourse, The Bronx
Typical rows of apartment houses in Bronx Borough.
In older Manhattan multi-family units were known generally as tenements or flats; but when the Bronx began to decelope-with the opening of the first subway transit system 20 years ago- there appeared the modern apartment house. Before the subway came, the Bronx had 250,000 population; now 20 years later it has nearly 900,000.
1924  Kadel & Herbert
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse and Tremont Ave.

text:
Grand Concourse, at the S.W. corner of East Tremont Ave., showing the Mt. Hope Methodist Episcopal Church. The 5-story apartment house, on the left, is No. 1895, at the S.W. corner of East 177th Street.

July 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - Tremont Avenue (East)
